titleStmt.title: Calendar of State Papers: Colonial Series

div.p: H.M. Warrant for appointment of Edward Bertie and John Hammerton, Secretary and Register of S. Carolina, for their lives and to be executed by them or sufficient Deputies, they having surrendered the grant of the said offices to them by the late Lords Proprietors etc. Countersigned, Holies Newcastle. Copy. [C.O. 324. 36. pp. 253, 254 ; and 324, 50. pp. 93, 94.]

Memorial of loss and damage (2704Z. 2s. 2d. sterl.) sustained by Solomon and Elias de Paz of London, merchants, owners of the Friendship and cargo taken 24th Feb. 1728(9), off Jamaica, by two Spanish vessels, on her voyage from New England to Barbados etc. The Friendship was bought and fitted out in New England on their account. Signed, Elias de Paz. Endorsed, Reed, (from Elias de Paz) 22nd Jan., 1731| pp. Enclosed, 2. i-viii. Invoice, bill of lading and correspondence relating to foregoing. [C.O. 388, 93. Nos. 4, 4 i-viii.]
H.M. Warrant for using the new Seal of N. Carolina. Countersigned, Holies Newcastle. Copy. [C.O. 324, 36. pp. 261, 262.]

Order of King in Council. Confirming Act of Jamaica concerning the estate of Thomas King, deed. Signed, Temple Stanyan. Endorsed, Reed. 10th, Read 11th Aug., 1731. 1J pp. [C.O. 137, 19. ff. 87, 87v., 8Sv.]

Order of King in Council. Confirming Act of Antigua, 1729, for cutting off the intail of lands formerly of John Bradshaw deed, and settling the same upon Francis Delap of Antigua, merchant, etc. Signed, Temple Stanyan. Endorsed, Reed. 10th, Read llth Aug., 1731. If pp. [C.O. 152, 19. ff. 63, Q7v.]

Order of King in Council. Confirming Act of Antigua, 1729, for cutting off the intail of lands formerly of John Bradshaw deed, and settling the same upon Francis Delap of Antigua, merchant, etc. Signed, Temple Stanyan. Endorsed, Reed. 10th, Read llth Aug., 1731. If pp. [C.O. 152, 19. ff. 63, Q7v.]
